title.narrative: HH BEHAVIOURS & SOCIAL CHANGE FOR NUTRIT

description.narrative: Capacities of implementing partners in 15 selected districts enhanced to promote appropriate household behaviors and social change for maternal nutrition, infant and young child feeding and care practices* to increase resilience in the community., which contributes to Infant And Young Child Feeding, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: At least 60% of children under 5 years equitably access quality promote, preventive and curative nutritional services by 2016

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF GENDER CHILDREN AND SOCIAL WELFARE
MINISTRY OF HEALTH AND POPULATION SERVICES

sector.narrative: Diet diversity in early childhood (children under 5), includes complementary feeding and MNPs
Maternal nutrition, including information, supplementation and counselling
Technical assistance - Prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacities of implementing partners in 15 selected districts enhanced to promote appropriate household behaviors and social changefor maternal nutrition, infant and young child feeding and care practices* to increase resilience in the community.

description.narrative: Capacities of implementing partners in fifteen targeted districts (100%) were enhanced to implement the minimum package to prevent stunting, reaching 220,897 children under-two years against a target of 322,199 (69%) and 37,846 pregnant women (100%) resulting in improved MIYCN and care practices contributing to increased resilience. | Status:Met | As-of Date:19/12/2018

title.narrative: Percentage of districts implementing the minimum package to prevent stunting in children
Number of primary caregivers of children aged 0-23 months who received counselling on IYCF
Proportion of mothers of children under two received counselling on key child caring practices in 14 districts ( EBF, CF, HIV, sanitation , hygiene and health)
Number of Community Health Workers trained with UNICEF support to provide infant and young child feeding counselling services in the reporting year
